title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 19): Building Solidarity Through Gift Circles and Mutual Aid Funds
summary: Create Gift Circles and Solidarity Funds as grassroots tools for sharing resources based on trust, reciprocity, and need. Build horizontal redistribution systems that work through mutual coordination, not domination.

Money.summary: Create democratic, transparent funds that redistribute resources based on need rather than worthiness.

level0: Gather circle of 5-15 people you trust who want to build mutual support
Host gift circle meeting with simple format of sharing needs and offers
level1: Seed solidarity fund through shared digital wallet or mutual pledge
Create agreements together about how fund operates
level2: Distribute based on self-disclosed need, not worthiness tests
Use transparent platforms to manage and distribute funds
level3: Build permanent infrastructure for community resource sharing
Support others in starting their own gift circles and funds

Community.summary: Build trust and mutual care through regular practice of giving and receiving support.

level0: Start from relationships, not rules - participation is voluntary
level1: Use sociocratic decision-making or consensus practices
Avoid gatekeeping or surveillance in resource distribution
level2: Meet regularly to reflect and adapt based on group feedback
Rotate facilitation roles and keep meetings welcoming
level3: Create lasting culture of mutual care and resource sharing
Model horizontal coordination for broader community

Knowledge.summary: Learn skills of facilitation, consensus building, and mutual aid organizing.

level0: Learn basic facilitation and circle-keeping skills
Practice sharing needs and offers without shame or judgment
level1: Develop skills in consensus decision-making and conflict resolution
Learn transparent fund management and democratic distribution
level2: Teach others how to start gift circles and solidarity funds
Share knowledge about mutual aid organizing principles
level3: Become resource for community care and mutual aid development
Train facilitators in Power With organizing methods

Narrative.summary: Shift from charity model to solidarity and mutual aid understanding of support.

level0: Practice seeing support as reciprocal rather than one-directional
Challenge narratives about deserving vs undeserving people
level1: Share stories about successful mutual aid and community care
Model abundance mindset over scarcity thinking
level2: Help others understand solidarity as alternative to charity
Promote mutual aid principles in community organizing
level3: Transform community culture toward mutual care and interdependence
Build widespread understanding of support as collective responsibility
